subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re:New Members level.
msgSnippet: Benjamin s suggestion of a semi-annual newsletter is interesting.  Is there anyone in the group that has the expertise and interest in putting something like
messageBody:
Benjamin's suggestion of a semi-annual newsletter is interesting. Is
there anyone in the group that has the expertise and interest in putting
something like this together on a small scale? If someone were willing
to be the organizer, I am sure some other members would be willing to
contribute.

By the way, due to incipient problems with spam two years or so ago,
which we wanted to nip in the bud, the site was changed to only allow
posting by members who have proven themselves to be human and not
shilling for some product that has nothing to do with QS.. In this
manner, we are spared the advertisements for pharmaceuticals, etc. My
pattern has been to edit a member's membership so that their posts are
unmoderated after they have attempted to post a message. Since we have
a healthy number of lurkers, many members have been members for years,
but still do not have unmoderated privileges. If you would like to be
able to post at a moment's notice, then you need to post a message or
send me an email directly asking that your membership be updated to
allow posting.

Paige

Benjamin Bruce wrote:
>
> That's great! I'm glad to know there's that many people interested
> in it.
>
> I was just thinking of an idea. Wouldn't it be neat if someone
> would start a small newsletter-type thing in and about Quickscript?
> Having it in PDF format on a website would probably be the best way to
> go, and I know it would be good reading practice for all of us. I
> know there's not much in the way of news about Quickscript, so it
> would be, perhaps, a twice-a-year publication.
>
> Anyway, I just thought I'd pass that idea on, and see if anyone
> wants to run with it. I don't have enough time to put something like
> this together, but I'd certainly be willing to contribute.
>
> -Benjamin Bruce
> Parker County, Texas
>
> --
> Check out BenjaBlog!
> Weekly posts on interesting and unique topics.
> Newest post: "Presidential Signature"
> www.benjaminbruce.us/blog/ <http://www.benjaminbruce.us/blog/>
>
>

Benjamin's suggestion of a semi-annual newsletter is interesting.  Is 
there anyone in the group that has the expertise and interest in putting 
something like this together on a small scale?  If someone were willing 
to be the organizer, I am sure some other members would be willing to 
contribute.

By the way, due to incipient problems with spam two years or so ago, 
which we wanted to nip in the bud, the site was changed to only allow 
posting by members who have proven themselves to be human and not 
shilling for some product that has nothing to do with QS..  In this 
manner, we are spared the advertisements for pharmaceuticals, etc.  My 
pattern has been to edit a member's membership so that their posts are 
unmoderated after they have attempted to post a message.  Since we have 
a healthy number of lurkers, many members have been members for years, 
but still do not have unmoderated privileges.  If you would like to be 
able to post at a moment's notice, then you need to post a message or 
send me an email directly asking that your membership be updated to 
allow posting.

Paige
